Posts.Content: hankyou Rachel, I have bought a post surgery front zip sports bra style bra from M&S..How does the implant boob look compared to the other? I know its obviously early days.... Havent got a cotton bag...wonder where I can get one today! Was your a crossover over shoulder one? Did it hurt having the drain out? Are you driving yet? Ive been quite chilled about it all till now!! Thanks again for your reply and sorry for the further questions! Andrea x
Posts.Title: Mastectomy on wednesday..any advice/tips?

Posts.Content: Hey, So going in Wednesday to have mastectomy with immediate reconstruction..feeling rather nervous now..I know everyone is different but any tips or advice greatly received.  Still got some questions running through my mind... Does anyone know or have had experience.....Having mastectomy due to large area of DCIS, what happens if invasive is found in the breast tissue ? Surely if they are removing the breast then its not an issue as such?? They are also removing lymph nodes so I know they will be tested. Love to all Andrea x
Posts.Title: Mastectomy on wednesday..any advice/tips?

Posts.Content: Rachel, thankyou your reply is really helpful. Do you mind sending me the bag thing lol?? How much did you pay? Not sure how to PM on here??
Posts.Title: Mastectomy on wednesday..any advice/tips?

Posts.Content: Hi Everyone, Wondering if anyone can help..so had mastectomy with immediate implant..im 3 weeks post surgery and have a few questions...I have another appointment next week but you know what its like when things on your mind :-) I know they say dont judge for at least 6 months but I have a dent on the inner part of my implant breast ( where cleaverage would be ) When I had drain in the BC nurse said it was because of that but that was out over a week ago and still there...Is this normal and likely to stay or disappear? Bras - So do I need to go out and but  non under wired bras? I obviously have one pert boob that doesnt move and then my normal one. Im only a c cup but without a bra its very noticeable...so will need to give the other a little lift so to speak....whats anoyones experience of this... I go on holiday in 5 weeks and already stressing about bikini/swim wear :-( Oh and will I be able to sunbathe?? My new boob still hurts to touch..I assume thats normal? Thankyou so much in advance Andy x
Posts.Title: Post mastectomy/reconstruction...Questions

Posts.Content: Hi,  I may have nipple sorted as I have lost that but havent even seen what that looks like yet as tape still across! I think im gonna want a lift but not sure if thats something I will have to pay for myself at some point...I cant believe it was 3 weeks ago for me..to be honest so far it hasnt been that bad. The drain was a complete pain in the bum but soon got used to it but such a relief when out! I had 2 lymph nodes removed ans that is causing me the most pain...but its manageable. x
Posts.Title: Post mastectomy/reconstruction...Questions

Posts.Content: Hi, I think its 6 weeks for the sports bra x
Posts.Title: Post mastectomy/reconstruction...Questions

Posts.Content: Thankyou thats really reassuring.... do you find without a bra that they look loads different eg old boob alot lower than new boob?
Posts.Title: Post mastectomy/reconstruction...Questions

Posts.Content: Morning, Feeling pretty good 5 days after my mastectomy/reconsruction..its just this blimin drain thats driving me insane! Mainly at night...any tips on actually getting comfortable to sleep....have at least another week/2 weeks with my new friend yet and the lack of proper sleep is the worst part post op so far. Love to all Andrea x
Posts.Title: 5 Days post op - tips on sleeping with drain!

Posts.Content: Hi, I had surgery 2 weeks ago today for high grade DCIS ( results tomorrow ekkkk) I had my drain out yesterday, im doing ok and just getting on with things as best I can but wondered how long the kick in the chest feeling lasts. It seems worse at night when trying to sleep / when I wake up to get comfortable. Its all still tender to touch too..I assume this is normal...got app tomorrow so will obviously ask but last week consultant happy with healing so far... Just not sure whats 'normal' Thanks in advance Andrea x
Posts.Title: Pain after mastectomy/implant reconstruction

Posts.Content: Hi,  Im not big busted but I had mastectomy 2 weeks ago today with immediate reconstruction...It went well ( still waiting result though ) I was in hospital for one night then came home with a drain which was the one thing I was stressing about....BUT if im honest you do get used to it. It is a complete pain in the bum. Had mine removed yesterday...back tomorrow for my results. What are you most worried about? Andrea xx
Posts.Title: Breast reconstrution

Posts.Content: Hi Jo, Thankyou for your reply... Im still new to this whats Nuclear grade mean? So are you having the mastectomy because of the invasive or the DCIS? I know on the whole scale of things its not important but im stressing that if I just have this next margin shave then radio I cant have reconstruction for a good few months. If I have mastectomy they will reconstruct at the same time. Its so hard..Ive gone from being told its probably nothing to 'Just dcis' to poss mastectomy in the space of a few weeks... xxx
Posts.Title: Qustion re High Grade DCIS

Posts.Content: Hi Jo, Just as soon as poss really, I am booked in Wednesday for the margin surgery but just not sure this is best option..I dont understand enough about DCIS...Mine is high grade does this mean its more likely to come back? Obviously I know there is no guarantees even with a mastectomy but must be less likely as most of the breast tissue is gone.. My DCIS presented with a lump which is very unusual apparently which is why they are surprised no invasive found so far... My SIL has just finished her Chemo, had op last week so just waiting for her results too..I only started checking mine when she got diagnosed... So hard being given the choice so to speak of which route to take  xx
Posts.Title: Qustion re High Grade DCIS

Posts.Content: Hi guys, So is the DCIS more likely to return if its High Grade? Im still trying to understand it all,,,I have a appointment now on Monday to discuss whether I go for a second op to get the margin they need or to go for Mastectomy... My consultant says go for the margin op but the weekly meeting they all have which he didnt attend recommended the mastectomy so very confused x
Posts.Title: Qustion re High Grade DCIS

Posts.Content: Hi..Was you just told to have Mastectomy or did you have the lumpectomy first? Whats Letrozole tablets? How was your recovery? Thanks xx
Posts.Title: Qustion re High Grade DCIS

Posts.Content: Thanks Caroline. the lump was measured at 2cm on the mamogram but after first lumpectomy 57mm..so alot bigger. No signs of invasive as it stands. I know its only me that can decide... Ill pop back on Monday after I decide... Thankyou so much for you help..Good luck on your journey xxx
Posts.Title: Qustion re High Grade DCIS

Posts.Content: Morning, I had my mastectomy last week with reconstruction due to high grade DCIS. I had 2 lymph nodes also removed. No traces so far found of any invasive cancer ( have had 2 lumpectomys prior)  but have been told there is a small chance..I go back next week for results. At my check up yesterday I asked what would happen if any invasive is found but my consultant who is lovely just said he doesnt like to deal with what ifs just what he knows! He seems confident nothing will be found but every app since Jan things got worse! Just wondered if anyone has any experience the same as me? Many thanks Andrea x
Posts.Title: Cant seem to get answer from my What if question...

Posts.Content: Thankyou for your reply...im not too familiar with the different types of Chemo...will you lose your hair? Have you had nodes checked now then? I thought that if invasive was found in just the breast tissus I wouldnt need further treatment as the tissue is gone? Wishing all the best xx
Posts.Title: Cant seem to get answer from my What if question...
